item.title: Report X-2025060918
item.description:
Report X-2025060918

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-08
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/8/2025 at approximately 0015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4108415 at the ramp facility in Phoenix, reporting potentially undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consists of 2 plastic drums. The drums are marked with "Adhesive 53S" and are prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, not displaying the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. DG Administration was unable to locate a corresponding safety data sheet online for this commodity. The drums are being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025060067
item.description:
Report E-2025060067

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 28, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon pail of printing ink was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal, then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect the released product. All impacted materials were containerized in the same one (1) 55-gallon waste drum.

item.title: Report X-2025051644
item.description:
Report X-2025051644

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN GOODYEAR, ARIZONA, ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED NUMEROUS UNSECURED PANASONIC CR2032 LITHIUM METAL COIN CELLS WITHIN THE BOX. MOST OF THE SMALL COIN CELLS ARE IN PLASTIC HOLDERS DESIGNED TO HOLD TWO CELLS EACH WITH THE CELLS OPENLY EXPOSED. NUMEROUS CELLS ARE LOOSE WITHIN THE BOX WITHOUT THEIR PLASTIC HOLDERS. THERE IS NO PROTECTION AGAINST SHORT CIRCUIT. NO ENCLOSURES SURROUNDING THE COIN CELLS. NO ADDITIONAL INNER PACKAGING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS ARE WITHIN THE BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO PHX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER H1A865, AMERICAN SCIENCE SURPLUS, 7410 N LEHIGH AVE, NILES IL 60714-4024.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT IR3 AND SEEN A PACKAGE LEAKING ON THE BELT AND ATTEMPTED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1144 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Phycomycin released from a plastic bag due to an unknown cause. The release impacted inside trailer#321-3154.ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined contractors assistance would be necessary due to tightly fitting goggles but was denied contractors assistance from the SCM Shannon Hoard, XPO would handle the clean-up of the release.

item.title: Report E-2025050545
item.description:
Report E-2025050545

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2055 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPH. It was reported that approximately 8-oz of "LAVALOCK CLEAR" released from a metal bucket due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3178217. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will place the waste inside of a 10-gallon metal drum. ERTS generated waste ID 235737-1.
